title: Citi Lebanon Introduces Interactive Derivatives Workshop
summary: Beirut – Citi Lebanon recently held a two-day derivatives workshop for its corporate clients. The event featured various hedging strategies in the face of financial risk scenarios threatening today's corporate world.
tag-1: Citi Lebanon Introduces Interactive Derivatives Workshop
tag-3: Beirut – Citi Lebanon recently held a two-day derivatives workshop for its corporate clients. The event featured various hedging strategies in the face of financial risk scenarios threatening today's corporate world.
tag-4: Conducted by Michal Kowalczuk, Head of Citi's FX Options Structuring in CEEMEA, Vijit Pai, Regional Treasury Sales Head, and Mounir Balkouch, Citi Lebanon Treasurer, the seminar featured 23 Treasury, Finance and Investment officers representing 17 of Lebanon's top local corporate entities.
tag-5: Participants formed virtual companies, each determining best hedging strategy in the face of a specific financial risk. Each 'company' held a variety of foreign exchange, interest rate and commodities exposures, and opted for 'positions' fitting pre-determined risk appetite. A competition for best hedging strategy concluded the seminar.
tag-6: Antoine Maroun, CEO of Citi Lebanon, highlighted the fact that Citi has always been a reference as a training institution for bankers and investment professionals around the globe. Following distribution of prizes and recognition certificates to participants, Mr. Maroun reiterated the importance of professional training for Citi as a primary global corporate objective:"This and other focused training efforts are in line with Citi's long-term strategy and commitment to developing local professional talent."
tag-7: "Our aim here was to show finance professionals how to best use derivatives in a constructive and responsible manner and to shed more light around these key treasury tools," added Mounir Belkouch. "The bank's novel approach was well received by treasury, finance and investment officers of top local companies and financial institutions. Trainees learned about various hedging strategies and developed a more insightful understanding of today's evolving financial risk in global capital markets."
tag-8: Citi has been in the Arab world for nearly 50 years and views the region as critical to its global franchise. It currently offers full-scale corporate and investment banking services in UAE, Bahrain, Qatar and Kuwait, Egypt, Lebanon, Jordan, Tunisia, Morocco and Algeria.
tag-9: With an established presence in Lebanon since the early 1950s, Citi Lebanon grew to become one of the leading foreign banks primarily servicing the banking needs of prime local and multinational corporates, local financial institutions and Public Sector entities. The bank offers a full range of corporate banking products, investment banking services, retail and private banking services to individuals, domestic corporations, multinationals, public sector entities, banks and financial institutions.
tag-10: Citi Citi, the leading global financial services company, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management. Additional information may be found at www.citigroup.com.
